goals.description: Climb to top of hill currently located in front of car.

metrics.description: Position provided as input to model

system.usage_context: An autonomous vehicle with an underpowered engine operating in a hilly environment, with control provided by a reinforcement learning model. The vehicle is constrained by an mission configuration that is prior to each use use, which defines the area of operation and regulations that the vehicle must comply with.

data.description: dataset is provided by a physics simulation egine
data.source: AI gymnasium (https://gymnasium.farama.org/ - loaded with import gymnasium as gym)
data.access: must be able to access/install packages

model.capability_deployment_mechanism: Loaded onto  using standard software update and configuration methods

output_specification.name: command
output_specification.description:
There are 3 discrete deterministic actions:

0: Accelerate to the left
1: Don’t accelerate
2: Accelerate to the right

system_requirements.source: user activates the gradient climber system
system_requirements.environment: normal operation with the vehicle stationary and located at the bottom of a hill
system_requirements.response: The model outputs manipulate the vehicle state to
system_requirements.measure: produces a position=0.6 at some time $t$<250

system_requirements.stimulus: Model receives valid input values from
system_requirements.environment: normal operation with the gradient climber system active
system_requirements.measure: and improves the expected reward 99.9% of the time

system_requirements.environment: normal operation with the gradient climber system active
system_requirements.response: The model will not produce output values that cause the vehicle to exit the area of operation specified in the set operational configuration.
system_requirements.measure: The position is compared to the operational parameters, and verified that -1.2<position<0.6

system_requirements.environment: normal operation with the gradient climber system active
system_requirements.response: The model will not produce output values that cause the velocity to exceed the legal speed limit set in the operational configuration.
system_requirements.measure: This is measured by making sure that $|vehicle_velocity|<0.05$ at all times.
